thread.title: Frank Lampard announces his retirement from football at 38 | The Independent
thread.title_full: Frank Lampard announces his retirement from football at 38 | The Independent

author: Samuel Lovett
title: Frank Lampard announces his retirement from football at 38 | The Independent
text:
Premier League Frank Lampard announces his retirement from football at 38 
'After 21 incredible years, I have decided that now is the right time to finish my career as a professional footballer,' Lampard said Thursday 2 February 2017 11:15 BST Click to followThe Independent Football 
Frank Lampard has announced his retirement from football after 21 years as a professional player. 
The former England international enjoyed spells with West Ham United, Chelsea and Manchester City before moving to America to play for MLS side New York City. 
In a statement released on his Facebook page, Lampard said: "After 21 incredible years, I have decided that now is the right time to finish my career as a professional footballer. 
"Whilst I have received a number of exciting offers to continue playing at home and abroad, at 38 I feel now is the time to begin the next chapter in my life. 
"I’m immensely proud of the trophies I’ve won, of representing my country over 100 times and of scoring more than 300 career goals." 
More to follow
